qas.question: About when did Alsace lose its prosperity?
Why did Alsace decline has a prospering territory?

answers.text: harsh winters, bad harvests, and the Black Death

qas.question: Which group of people were wrongly blamed for all the disasters that struck the region?
What were the jewish people accused of in Alsace?

answers.text: accused of poisoning the wells with plague

qas.question: When did the Rhine Rift earthquake occur?
During what year were Jews blamed for the poor harvest?
What administration brought ruin to Alsace at the end of the 14th century?
Who was aquitted of guilt for the Rhine rift earthquake?

context: As in much of Europe, the prosperity of Alsace came to an end in the <a0_0>14th century<a0_0/> by a series of <a1_0>harsh winters, bad harvests, and the Black Death<a1_0/>. These hardships were <a2_0>blamed on Jews<a2_0/>, leading to the pogroms of 1336 and 1339. In <b5_0>1349<b5_0/>, Jews of Alsace were <a3_0>accused of poisoning the wells with plague<a3_0/>, leading to the massacre of thousands of Jews during the Strasbourg pogrom. <b9_0>Jews<b9_0/> were subsequently forbidden to settle in the town. An additional natural disaster was <b8_0>the Rhine rift earthquake<b8_0/> of <a4_0><b7_0>1356<b7_0/>,<a4_0/> one of Europe's worst which made ruins of Basel. Prosperity returned to Alsace under <b6_0>Habsburg<b6_0/> administration during the Renaissance.
